title: Reconciliation Offers a Shot at Simpler Government
sub_head: Liberals and conservatives alike should see the benefit of reducing complexity in programs and rules.
body:
In the reconciliation bill, lawmakers propose to spend trillions of dollars on child care, healthcare, education and other necessary initiatives. Unfortunately, many government programs suffer from a common defect: complexity. If the new bill adds complexity, millions of Americans won’t get essential assistance and the country won’t get its money’s worth.
Liberals and conservatives alike should care about solving the complexity problem. It would reduce administrative burdens on individuals and businesses and make government programs more cost-effective, while making it faster and easier for eligible Americans to get the assistance they need.
